documentType: U Nonimmigrant Status Certification form (I-918 Supplement B)
summary: This is a partially completed USCIS Form I-918 Supplement B, intended for a victim of crime to apply for U Nonimmigrant Status. The document is a template with instructions for the FBI to complete sections related to the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically regarding criminal acts of sexual exploitation and trafficking, and the injury to a victim named Ms. De Georgiou.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in a court case; the criminal activity being investigated relates to charges against her for sexual exploitation and trafficking.

persons.name: Ms. De Georgiou
persons.context: Referenced as a victim whose injury needs to be described in the certification form as part of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The form instructs the FBI to describe the criminal activity and injury to Ms. De Georgiou as part of the investigation into charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a U visa certification form (I-918 Supplement B) dated April 24, 2019, to be completed by the FBI.
It explicitly links the form's completion to the investigation and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell, referencing her indictment.
The specified criminal activities are sexual exploitation and trafficking, to be detailed with dates and U.S. Code violations.
A specific victim, Ms. De Georgiou, is named, indicating her injury is a subject of the investigation.
The form is a procedural document showing the process of seeking immigration benefits (U Nonimmigrant Status) for a victim assisting in a federal criminal investigation.
